snippet: President François Hollande of France is building a far more confident image abroad than at home, a striking contrast that shows how much his nation values a role in world affairs.
abstract: Memo from France; French Pres Francois Hollande is building a far more assertive and confident image abroad than he is at home, most notably in Israel, where he has been embraced by Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu as a vital player in the debate about Iran's nuclear ambitions; contrast between his handling of domestic and foreign policy is striking and is evidence that France values assertive role in world affairs.

byline.contributor: Maïa de la Baume and Scott Sayare contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President François Hollande of France is building a far more confident image abroad than at home, a striking contrast that shows how much his nation values a role in world affairs.

headline.main: Hollande’s Assertive Role in Foreign Policy Is a Good Fit for France
headline.print_headline: Hollande’s Assertive Role in Foreign Policy Is a Good Fit for France
